meanings.definition: To cause someone to become unable to move or act
meanings.sent1: The fear of heights can be paralyzing for some people.
meanings.sent2: The spider's venom paralyzing its prey before consuming it.
meanings.sent3: The thought of public speaking was so paralyzing that he pretended to be sick.
meanings.sent4: The icy grip of fear paralyzing her every movement.
meanings.sent5: The sudden realization of failure was paralyzing, freezing him in place.

meanings.definition: Causing someone to become unable to move or act
meanings.sent1: The paralyzing fear of failure held her back from taking risks.
meanings.sent2: The paralyzing effect of the snake's venom spread quickly through his body.
meanings.sent3: The paralyzing cold wind made everyone shiver uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The paralyzing grip of fear tightened around her heart.
meanings.sent5: The paralyzing realization of being lost in the forest set in as night fell.
